resources.string: My project focuses on Jewish representation in Japanese media. I analyzed Tezuka Osamu\'s manga "Message to Adolf". The manga focuses on World War II in Japan. It is based off the rumors that Hitler had Jewish ancestry. The manga focuses on three people named Adolf. The first is Adolf Hitler, the second is Adolf Kaufmann (Japanese/German), and Adolf Kamil (Jewish).

In the manga, Jews are portrayed as strong, confident, trustworthy and moral. Tezuka highlights Jews and their suffering during the Holocaust. But oddly, I also found that Japan depicted themselves as victims alongside the Jews.
Japan uses Jews to rewrite their militant history.

This app was made for a Judaism through Film class at Mills College in Spring 2018. It contains three other sections. The manga section for a preview of the manga, a quiz for learning about the topic, and the bibliography.
